Publications
Thank You
Poet: Malya

Thank you to the unasked soldiers
Those who fought for a future where I can be who I am
No one asked you to fight in a war borne of hate and ignorance
One that was fought in the streets and in the mind and in the heart
But you did
So thank you

Because of you we don’t have to be ashamed of who we are
Because of you we can have a girlfriend or a boyfriend or any type of partner we want
Because of you we can use the pronouns and the names we chose instead of those branded on our skin
Because of you we can find reassurance in those we love when the dysphoria gets too much instead of jumping off a ledge
Because we know we have each other
So thank you

The brick in your fist became my partner’s hand in mine
The broken glass in your palm changed to the shattered gender norms in my clothes
The blood on your face turned to the rainbows painted on my cheeks
The slurs and slander you endured transformed into the reassurance and respect I adore
The hate in your family’s eyes became the love in mine
So thank you

I’ll never read your names in a textbook or on a memorial statue
But I'll still know who you are and all you did for me
I’ll see it in my The New Yorker poster of Bert and Ernie watching gay marriage become legalized
I’ll see it in the queer princesses in the cartoons I like
I’ll feel it in the warmth of my mother’s smile instead of a cold shoulder
I’ll feel it in the embraces of my best friend who looks at me the way she has since we were kids
I’ll hear it when I get to say ‘I do’
I’ll hear it in the laughter of my children who will grow up in a world without hate
Because I will fight for their future
Like you did for mine
So thank you
